DataElement.preferredName: CRLF2 Gene Or Janus Kinase Family Genetic Information Processing Pathway Abnormality Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown response to a question asking if evidence of gene rearrangement or alteration is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: CRLF2 Gene Or Janus Kinase Family Genetic Information Processing Pathway Abnormality
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in cytokine binding and signaling._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A family of intracellular, non-receptor tyrosine-protein kinases. These enzymes transduce signals from certain cytokine receptors by phosphorylating and activating members of the Signal Transducer and Activator of Transcription (STAT) family of transcription factor proteins._A sequence of biological or biochemical events that are involved in the conversion of genetic information into physiologically active molecules, such as functional RNA and proteins._A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in cytokine binding and signaling.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A family of intracellular, non-receptor tyrosine-protein kinases. These enzymes transduce signals from certain cytokine receptors by phosphorylating and activating members of the Signal Transducer and Activator of Transcription (STAT) family of transcription factor proteins.
A sequence of biological or biochemical events that are involved in the conversion of genetic information into physiologically active molecules, such as functional RNA and proteins.
